Articles.Content:
**Do you want to have more bases but there's no funds and you need more science? Ever thinked that there should be problems on the bases? Have you ever wanted to scan, then explore and after that make the actual base?** Now you got this:

This is a Contract Configurator contract pack for base constuction and mantenaince. This CP is made for letting the player build a base on any body and then expand it and maintain it. The stock base contracts are disabled. All the vessels listed as a base are going to be affected by the mantenaince contracts. Since the contracts doesn't need docking, just land very close to the core, MKS and KAS are supported. This also support SCANsat for the scanning contract. And USILS, TACLS and IFILS are supported for the life support contracts.

This is how a complete base look like: 

![screenshot0_zpsr7yohnsb.png](http://i1148.photobucket.com/albums/o574/CosmoBr0/screenshot0_zpsr7yohnsb.png)

You can clearly look at the rover and notice there are no phisical conections between the Base phases.

This had a [dev thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124301).

This is a little summary of the contracts

> 
> //Create Contracts
> 
> 1. Scan for a suitable location for the new Base: Choose a body for the new base
> 
> 2.Land a rover on the choosen body
> 
> 3.Base Creation on choosen body: A simple base created on the choosen body (note: this must be unmanned)
> 
> 4. Base Population: Put kerbals on the base (just appears if there aren't kerbals on the base)
> 
> 5.Science Expansion for the choosen body Base: Put a science lab near the base
> 
> 6.Crew Expansion for the choosen body base: Add extra crew space to the base
> 
> 7.Life Support Expansion for the Base: (It'll only appear if you have TACLS or USILS): Add some LS converters
> 
> All Base Create Contracts can be done on any Celestial body (1 time per body)
> 
> //Manteinance Contracts
> 
> 8.Do a supply run to the choosen body Base.(It'll only appear if you have TACLS,USILS or IFILS): Bring food down to the base
> 
> 9.Do a crew rotation to the Base: Just take 2 kerbals from the base and put another 2 there
> 
> 10.Communication problem on the Base: There's no connection with the base, send a vessel to check the base
> 
> Extra
> 
> 10.Medical Emergency on board the Base(thanks to [severedsolo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/82445-severedsolo) for this one): Evacuate a kerbal from the base and bring him back to kerbin

Download:

CKAN: Contract Pack: Base Constuction

> 
> Manual instalation: [Github](https://github.com/CosmoBro/BaseConstruction/releases)
> 
> This need some mods for working
> 
> [Contract Configurator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101604) (min. v.1.6.4)
> 
> Contract Configurator is licensed under the [MIT License](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).
> 
> [Module Manager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219) (min. v.2.6.7)
> 
> Module Manager is licensed under the CC share-alike license
> 
> 

Also there are some mods that I like and can complement your game experience with this contract pack

> 
> [USI Kolonization Systems](http://USI) for the base parts and also a Proximity logistics that allow you to transfer resources from disconnected bases
> 
> [USI Life Support](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116790) I do recommend you this because is a simple LS but if you want TACLS or IFILS it doesn't matter because they're all supported 
> 
> [Kerbal Attachment System](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92514) For the pipes that alow conection without docking
> 
> [SCANsat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80369) for the scanning system that would let you to choose a better landing spot 
> 
> [Nav Hud](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81543) that helps for target landing
> 
> 

Hard Mode: [DOWNLOAD](https://github.com/CosmoBro/BaseConstruction/raw/master/BCHardMode.zip)

With thhis you would need to dock the base phases (just affect the creation contracts)

Regarding your poll, I tend to have refining on both the surface and in orbit. I use the one on the surface to produce the fuel to re-fuel the vessel that then takes ore up to the orbital facility. The one on the surface is usually a smaller set-up than the one in orbit.

> 
> Regarding your poll, I tend to have refining on both the surface and in orbit. I use the one on the surface to produce the fuel to re-fuel the vessel that then takes ore up to the orbital facility. The one on the surface is usually a smaller set-up than the one in orbit.

Which is why having the ore/fuel weight be the same for the "conservation of mass" argument is silly. Ore should be an order of magnitude heavier, and the the weight loss due to refining is handwaved away by saying the "ore dust" is released.
